algorithm_technique: Transform Manhattan distance to sum and difference of coordinates.
Find min/max of (x+y) and (x-y) to determine max distance.
problem_summary_simple: Remove one point to minimize the maximum Manhattan distance between any two remaining points.
problem_summary_technical: Minimize max Manhattan distance by removing a point. Max distance is determined by max/min of (x+y) and (x-y) sums/differences.
key_insights: The Manhattan distance |x1 - x2| + |y1 - y2| can be rewritten using transformations: max(|(x1+y1)-(x2+y2)|, |(x1-y1)-(x2-y2)|).
This means the maximum Manhattan distance is determined by the maximum difference between (x+y) values and (x-y) values.
By finding the points that contribute to the extreme (min/max) sums and differences, we can efficiently check which point's removal yields the minimum maximum distance.
